what is near? NEAR Protocol is a decentralized blockchain platform designed to enable the creation and execution of decentralized applications (dApps). It aims to provide a scalable and secure infrastructure for developers to build and deploy decentralized applications on the blockchain. NEAR Protocol uses a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, which allows for faster and more efficient transaction processing compared to other blockchain platforms. This is achieved through a unique sharding design, where transactions are processed in parallel across multiple shards. One of the key features of NEAR Protocol is its focus on developer experience, with a user-friendly development environment, built-in smart contract languages, and support for popular programming languages such as Rust and AssemblyScript. NEAR also offers a range of developer tools, including its own decentralized storage solution, which can be used to store and retrieve data in a secure and decentralized manner. Overall, NEAR Protocol aims to provide a blockchain platform that is accessible and user-friendly for developers, while also offering a highly scalable and secure infrastructure for the creation and execution of decentralized applications.
);
